title: Harris and Hughes on Danse Africaine - claim

content.question: Which of the following quotes from Source 1 best represents the author’s overall argument?

choices.label: “While some writers, such as Langston Hughes, traveled to Africa..., many others never made the trip.”
“[African American writers’] efforts to claim African identity...were rooted more in imagination and reading knowledge than in actual facts.”
“Vachel Lindsay is [a white writer who influenced African American ones]. His poems in the vein of ‘The Congo’ influenced Langston Hughes’s poetic imagination.”
“African American writers were also not immune to notions of dark Africa that Joseph Conrad popularized in Heart of Darkness (1902).”

content.answer: “[African American writers’] efforts to claim African identity...were rooted more in imagination and reading knowledge than in actual facts.”

topic.text: 3.13: Envisioning Africa in Harlem Renaissance Poetry

skill.text: 2.A: Identify and explain a source's claim(s), evidence, and reasoning.
